papers.title: A Dynamic LLM-Powered Agent Network for Task-Oriented Agent Collaboration
papers.summary: DyLAN: A framework for dynamic LLM-powered agent collaboration with automatic team selection and adaptive communication structures. Achieves up to 25% accuracy improvement on MMLU tasks.

papers.title: Semi-Supervised Classification with Graph Convolutional Networks
papers.summary: Foundational work on Graph Convolutional Networks (GCN) - a scalable approach for semi-supervised learning on graph-structured data that scales linearly with graph edges.

papers.title: LightReasoner: Can Small Language Models Teach Large Language Models Reasoning?
papers.summary: A novel framework where smaller language models teach larger ones by revealing high-value reasoning moments. Improves accuracy by 28.1% while reducing time by 90% and token usage by 99%.

papers.title: GRAG: Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation
papers.summary: Extends RAG to handle networked documents by retrieving textual subgraphs and integrating textual and topological information into LLMs for enhanced multi-hop reasoning.
